title: I'm Buying These 30 Under-$100 Items to Look Trust-Fund Rich During Nordstrom's Early Black Friday Sale
excerpt: One editor breaks down 30 luxe-looking items, from jeans to ankle boots, to add to your online cart during Nordstrom's early Black Friday sale event.
text: Nordstrom’s Early Black Friday Sale is here to kick off the holiday shopping season in style. With discounts on chic, elevated pieces, this sale is your chance to snag the perfect French-girl jeans, slouchy sweaters, and classic booties—just in time for all your upcoming seasonal events (and, of course, before the rest of the brands kick off deep discounts for Cyber Week).Whether you’re refreshing your wardrobe or looking for that statement piece, Nordstrom has you covered with must-haves that combine effortless style with quality craftsmanship. From cozy knits to timeless accessories, these elevated essentials will keep you looking polished all winter long. But hurry—the sale ends on November 20, so don’t miss out on scoring the pieces that will take your closet to the next level.Below, scroll through all of the best rich-looking pieces for under $100 and treat yourself (or get a head start on gift shopping) before the season really heats up. Nordstrom Cashmere Turtleneck Sweater A pop of red is always a good idea. Nordstrom Mercer Leather Belt This is such an easy way to dress up jeans and a basic white tee. Good American Good Skate Straight Leg Jeans Good American always does denim so well. Marc Fisher LTD Ubet Ballet Flat This pair is making the outfit ideas start churning in my head. Nordstrom V-Neck Cashmere Sweater It doesn't get more elegant than a simple gray V-neck sweater. Nordstrom Miah Water Resistant Chelsea Lug Boot These are leaving quite the impression. Nordstrom Relaxed Fit Blazer I'll never say no to cashmere. Another pair of sleek shoes that Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen would be big fans of. Nordstrom Flat Front Wide Leg Pants Perfect for in-office meetings and post-work dirty martinis with your co-workers. Sam Edelman Michaela Mary Jane Flat NYDJ Marilyn Straight Leg Jeans This dark-rinse pair is calling my name. Nadri Perfect Cubic Zirconia Huggie Hoop Earrings Favorite Daughter The Favorite Skirt This red slip skirt looks expensive. Steve Madden Lazio Platform Bootie Vince Camuto Wide Collar Sweater Reformation Lucas Relaxed Merino Wool Sweater Reformation has never let me down. Sam Edelman Zooey Ballet Flat This pair is an immediate yes in my book. Nordstrom Relaxed Fit Pima Cotton Crewneck T-Shirt The perfect white tee doesn't exis— KUT from the Kloth Goldie Patch Pocket High Waist Super Flare Jeans Run, don't walk, to get this pair. Steve Madden Vinka Bootie This deep olive color is everything to me. Topshop Funnel Neck Rib Sweater Okay, Topshop. I see you! Joe's The Trixie Cuffed High Waist Ankle Wide Leg Jeans Cuffed jeans are it this season. Chinese Laundry Dodger Bootie This wood merlot color is doing a number on me. Treasure & Bond Rib Bishop Sleeve Cardigan Cozy and comfortable. What's not to love? Nordstrom Arazio Kitten Heel Bootie Can't you tell I have a thing for black booties at this point? Caslon Mock Neck Tunic Sweater My jaw dropped when I saw how well-priced this sweater was. Circus NY by Sam Edelman Tara Slingback Pump This pair looks designer. AG Kora High Waist Wide Leg Jeans I'll leave you with this pretty pair. Ana Escalante is an award-winning journalist and Gen Z editor whose work ranges from dissecting size inclusivity at fashion week to discussing how American Girl Doll meme accounts are the the answer to society's collective spiral. She's covered it all: Queen Elizabeth II's corgis, Roe v. Wade frontline protests, and the emergence of jorts (or jean shorts for the uninitated). At Who What Wear, Ana is responsible for delivering smart, insightful, personality-driven shopping guides and trend features for a digital-first generation.Before joining Who What Wear, Ana was Glamour magazine's editorial assistant, where she focused on daily news and special packages, including leading the brand's 2022 Met Gala coverage. For more than half a decade, she has covered style, beauty, and digital culture for publications such as Paper magazine, Harper's Bazaar, Vogue Japan, and Allure, among others. Ana has been called a rising star in media by publications such as Nylon and Teen Vogue. (Her mother, meanwhile, calls her "the coolest person" she knows.)
html:
Nordstrom’s Early Black Friday Sale is here to kick off the holiday shopping season in style. With discounts on chic, elevated pieces, this sale is your chance to snag the perfect French-girl jeans, slouchy sweaters, and classic booties—just in time for all your upcoming seasonal events (and, of course, before the rest of the brands kick off deep discounts for Cyber Week).

Whether you’re refreshing your wardrobe or looking for that statement piece, Nordstrom has you covered with must-haves that combine effortless style with quality craftsmanship. From cozy knits to timeless accessories, these elevated essentials will keep you looking polished all winter long. But hurry—the sale ends on November 20, so don’t miss out on scoring the pieces that will take your closet to the next level.

Below, scroll through all of the best rich-looking pieces for under $100 and treat yourself (or get a head start on gift shopping) before the season really heats up.

Nordstrom

Cashmere Turtleneck Sweater

A pop of red is always a good idea.

Nordstrom

Mercer Leather Belt

This is such an easy way to dress up jeans and a basic white tee.

Good American

Good Skate Straight Leg Jeans

Good American always does denim so well.

Marc Fisher LTD

Ubet Ballet Flat

This pair is making the outfit ideas start churning in my head.

Nordstrom

V-Neck Cashmere Sweater

It doesn't get more elegant than a simple gray V-neck sweater.

Nordstrom

Miah Water Resistant Chelsea Lug Boot

These are leaving quite the impression.

Nordstrom

Relaxed Fit Blazer

I'll never say no to cashmere.

Another pair of sleek shoes that Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen would be big fans of.

Nordstrom

Flat Front Wide Leg Pants

Perfect for in-office meetings and post-work dirty martinis with your co-workers.

Sam Edelman

Michaela Mary Jane Flat

NYDJ

Marilyn Straight Leg Jeans

This dark-rinse pair is calling my name.

Nadri

Perfect Cubic Zirconia Huggie Hoop Earrings

Favorite Daughter

The Favorite Skirt

This red slip skirt looks expensive.

Steve Madden

Lazio Platform Bootie

Vince Camuto

Wide Collar Sweater

Reformation

Lucas Relaxed Merino Wool Sweater

Reformation has never let me down.

Sam Edelman

Zooey Ballet Flat

This pair is an immediate yes in my book.

Nordstrom

Relaxed Fit Pima Cotton Crewneck T-Shirt

The perfect white tee doesn't exis—

KUT from the Kloth

Goldie Patch Pocket High Waist Super Flare Jeans

Run, don't walk, to get this pair.

Steve Madden

Vinka Bootie

This deep olive color is everything to me.

Topshop

Funnel Neck Rib Sweater

Okay, Topshop. I see you!

Joe's

The Trixie Cuffed High Waist Ankle Wide Leg Jeans

Cuffed jeans are it this season.

Chinese Laundry

Dodger Bootie

This wood merlot color is doing a number on me.

Treasure & Bond

Rib Bishop Sleeve Cardigan

Cozy and comfortable. What's not to love?

Nordstrom

Arazio Kitten Heel Bootie

Can't you tell I have a thing for black booties at this point?

Caslon

Mock Neck Tunic Sweater

My jaw dropped when I saw how well-priced this sweater was.

Circus NY by Sam Edelman

Tara Slingback Pump

This pair looks designer.

AG

Kora High Waist Wide Leg Jeans

I'll leave you with this pretty pair.

Ana Escalante is an award-winning journalist and Gen Z editor whose work ranges from dissecting size inclusivity at fashion week to discussing how American Girl Doll meme accounts are the the answer to society's collective spiral. She's covered it all: Queen Elizabeth II's corgis, Roe v. Wade frontline protests, and the emergence of jorts (or jean shorts for the uninitated). At Who What Wear, Ana is responsible for delivering smart, insightful, personality-driven shopping guides and trend features for a digital-first generation.Before joining Who What Wear, Ana was Glamour magazine's editorial assistant, where she focused on daily news and special packages, including leading the brand's 2022 Met Gala coverage. For more than half a decade, she has covered style, beauty, and digital culture for publications such as Paper magazine, Harper's Bazaar, Vogue Japan, and Allure, among others. Ana has been called a rising star in media by publications such as Nylon and Teen Vogue. (Her mother, meanwhile, calls her "the coolest person" she knows.)
